subject: Management
title: Kotter's Eight Steps
description: A quick win: understand Kotter's Eight Steps.

hook.text: John Kotter studied 100+ organizations and found the same eight mistakes in every failed change.

buildup.text: His model: urgency, coalition, vision, communication, empowerment, quick wins, consolidation, anchoring.

discovery.text: Each step builds on the last. Skip one and the whole sequence weakens.

twist.text: Most leaders jump to step four (communication) without building urgency or coalition first. That's why they fail.

climax.text: Start with urgency. Build a team. Create a vision. Then communicate. Follow the sequence.

punchline.text: Eight steps, in order. Shortcuts are why change fails.

quiz.question: What is the first step in Kotter's eight-step change model?
options: Creating a sense of urgency about the need for change
Communicating the change vision to all employees
